openApp

public boolean openApp()
Open the application to the default view.

We open the application URL defined in the SUT config file (and maximize the browser window if set), then set the default view specified in the UI Map (e.g., the Welcome page).

NOTE: The Selenium server and browser are started by HpcTestUiObject().

Returns:
true if successfully opens the application to the default view; otherwise, returns false.

openApp

public boolean openApp(java.lang.String view)
Open the application to the specified view.

clickOn

public boolean clickOn(java.lang.String elementName)
Click on an element. 1. Some elements (like values in a drop down list) may not be present in the DOM until after their activator is clicked. Activators are defined in the UI Map using "activator": <value>.

2. Many clickable items will cause navigation to a new view; this is also specified in the UI Map using "view": <value>.

3. All the heavy lifting is done in the private method uiMapClickOnLocatorAndSetView(). This means checking all areas in the current view for the element specified, and if it is a list item, locating it by index or by a matching string or regex.

Parameters:
elementName - The name of the element you wish to click (from the uiMap).
Returns:
true if successfully finds the specified element, clicks on it and (if the view should change according to the UI Map) the appropriate view is displayed. Otherwise, returns false.

verifyClickOnAndMessageIsShown

public boolean verifyClickOnAndMessageIsShown(java.lang.String elementName,
                                              java.lang.String message)
Click on the specified element and verify than a message is shown.

Parameters:
elementName - The name of the element you want to click on.
message - The message (literal text, regex or a message id) you expect displayed.
Returns:
true if the element was clicked and the message was displayed; otherwise, returns false.

verifyClickOnAndErrorIsShown

public boolean verifyClickOnAndErrorIsShown(java.lang.String elementName,
                                            java.lang.String errorMessage)
Click on the specified element and verify than an error message is shown.

Parameters:
elementName - The name of the element you want to click on.
errorMessage - The error message (literal text, regex or a message id) you expect displayed.
Returns:
true if the element was clicked and the error message was displayed; otherwise, returns false.

clickBack

public void clickBack()
Go back to the previous view.

Returns to the previous view by simulating a click on the browser Back button, then updates the UI Map in a way that retains forward breadcrumbs so that clickForward() works as expected.

clickForward

public boolean clickForward()
Go forward to the next page (after having previously used clickBack() at least once).

Advances to a prior view by simulating a click on the browser Forward button, then updates the UI Map in a way that enables clickBack() works as expected.

Returns:
true if successfully navigates forward (or there is no forward view to go to); otherwise, returns false.

clickRefresh

public boolean clickRefresh()
Refresh the current page. The UI Map is not changed.

Returns:
Always returns true.

setViewTo

public boolean setViewTo(java.lang.String requestedView)
Opens the requested view.

Uses the UI Map to determine how to navigate to the requested view from the current view.

Parameters:
requestedView - The "Page:View" you wish to display. If blank (""), it will open the default view of the default page of the application as specified in the UI Map.
Returns:
true if successfully opens the specified view; otherwise, returns false.

getValueOf

public java.lang.String getValueOf(java.lang.String elementName)
Gets the value of the specified element (text box, select list, checkbox, etc.).

Gets the value of inputs (text boxes), the label of selects, the "on" or "off" value for checkboxes, and the text of other elements.

Parameters:
elementName - The name of the element you want to get the value of.
Returns:
Returns the value of the specified element or returns an empty string ("") if the element was not found.

getValueOf

public java.lang.String getValueOf(java.lang.String elementName,
                                   java.lang.String attribute)
Gets the value of an attribute of the specified element.

Parameters:
elementName - The name of the element you want to check.
attribute - The name of the attribute you want to check.
Returns:
Returns the value of the specified element's attribute or returns an empty string ("") if the element or attribute was not found.

getValueOf

public java.lang.String getValueOf(java.lang.String listName,
                                   java.lang.String itemMatching,
                                   java.lang.String elementName)
Gets the value of an element in a list item that matches the specified string or regex.

Parameters:
listName - The name of the list containing the element.
itemMatching - An index, message id or regex to locate a specific item in the list.
elementName - The name of the element you want to get the value of.
Returns:
Returns the value of the specified element or returns an empty string ("") if the element or a matching list item were not found.

getValueOf

public java.lang.String getValueOf(java.lang.String listName,
                                   java.lang.String itemMatching,
                                   java.lang.String elementName,
                                   java.lang.String attribute)
Gets the value of an attribute of an element in a list item that matches a literal string or regex expression.

NOTE: Used by verifyValueOf().

Parameters:
listName - The name of the list containing the element.
itemMatching - An index, message id or regex to locate a specific item in the list.
elementName - The name of the element you want to check.
attribute - The name of the attribute you want to get the value of.
Returns:
Returns the value of the specified element's attribute or returns an empty string ("") if the element, attribute or a matching list item were not found.

setValueTo

public boolean setValueTo(java.lang.String listName,
                          java.lang.String itemMatching,
                          java.lang.String elementName,
                          java.lang.String value)
Sets an element (text, checkbox, radio button, list) to the specified value.

Parameters:
listName - The name of the list containing your element, or empty string if element is not in a list.
itemMatching - The index (starting at 1) of the list item containing your element, a regex used to find a list item with matching text, or empty string if element is not in a list.
elementName - The name of the element you want to set.
value - The value you want it set to. Checkboxes take "true" or "on" to check, "false" or "off" to uncheck.
Returns:
true if the element was found and set successfully; otherwise, returns false.

setValueTo

public boolean setValueTo(java.lang.String elementName,
                          java.lang.String value)
Sets an element (text, checkbox, radio button, list) to the specified value. Simply calls setValueTo(listName, itemMatching, elementName, value), which does all the work. Returns "" if elementName could not be found in the current page.

Parameters:
elementName - The name of the element you want to set.
value - The value you want it set to. Checkboxes take "true" or "on" to check, "false" or "off" to uncheck.
Returns:
true if the element was found and set successfully; otherwise, returns false.

verifyIsNotShown

public boolean verifyIsNotShown(java.lang.String item)
Verify than an element, message or regex is NOT visible on the page.

NOTES:

1. Supports verifying that a message or text is NOT shown in another (pop-up) window than the main application. However, elements can only be checked in the main application window.

2. The private method verifyIsShown() does all the heavy lifting.

Parameters:
item - The element name, literal text, or regex to be checked for visibility on the page.
Returns:
true if the item is NOT visible; otherwise, returns false.

verifyIsNotShown

public boolean verifyIsNotShown(java.lang.String listName,
                                java.lang.String itemMatching)
Verify than a list item matching a specified string or regex is NOT visible on the page.

NOTES: The private method verifyIsShown() does all the heavy lifting.

Parameters:
listName - The name of the list containing the element.
itemMatching - The string or regex used to locate the matching list item.
Returns:
true if the item is NOT visible; otherwise, logs a failure and returns false.

                                java.lang.String itemMatching,

NOTES: The private method verifyIsShown() does all the heavy lifting.

Parameters:

itemMatching - The string or regex used to locate the matching list item.
elementName - The element name to be checked for visibility on the page.
Returns:

verifyViewIs

public boolean verifyViewIs(java.lang.String expectedView)
Verify the current view.

Verifies the current view by checking the uiMap current view name and also by verifying the default area is ready. If the expectedView matches a page name, also checks the current page name and URL. If the view has a specified path element, it will also check for that in the current URL. In the case of both the page and view path value, we search for contains or regex match. Finding a matching page OR view is sufficient.

Parameters:
expectedView - The expected view name (just the Page OR the View, not Page:View).
Returns:
true if the current Page and/or View matches expectedView; otherwise, logs a failure and returns false.

verifyURLIs

public boolean verifyURLIs(java.lang.String expectedPageURL)
Convenience method for verifying the URL.

Verifies the URL matches expected

Parameters:
expectedPageURL - The expected URL.
Returns:
true if the URL matches expected; otherwise, logs a failure and returns false.

uiMapUpdateView

public boolean uiMapUpdateView(java.lang.String view)
Convenience method for updating the UI Map objects with the current view. Single-arg wrapper for uiMapUpdateView() that always adds a new view and deletes any forward bread crumbs. Parameters:

Parameters:

Returns:
true if view was updated successfully.

uiMapElementLocator

public java.lang.String uiMapElementLocator(java.lang.String elementName)
References UI Map to determine correct locator for the specified elementName. Simply calls uiMapGetElementAttribute, which does all the work. Returns "" if elementName could not be found in the current page.

Parameters:
elementName - - The identifier of the element you want to locate.
Returns:
- The locator (typically css) of the element you are looking for.

waitByTimeout

public void waitByTimeout(long waitFor)
Convenience method for waiting for specified amount of time (in milliseconds). Parameters:

Parameters:
waitFor - The time to wait in milliseconds. TODO: DCC - We should find a better means in the framework to deal with timeouts than a public methods called in numerous test cases. Tests should not have to be written to compensate for timing - all this should be handled by the framework in an efficient and robust fashion. Using waitByTimeout() in test cases slows test execution and results in fragile test code.

KeyPress

public void KeyPress(org.openqa.selenium.Keys key)
Convenience method for Triggering a keypress event.. Parameters:

Parameters:
key - The java constant for the key to press (e.g.,java.awt.event.KeyEvent.VK_ENTER). TODO: DCC - We should find a better means in the framework to deal with pressing ENTER. This is only used in one test: TestLoginInHPCWithePC1UserAccount_US11365().

closeSubTab

public boolean closeSubTab(java.lang.String subtabname)
When we click on a link on the current page, it will open another new window or new sub tab , we need to swich to the new window or tab. Convenience method for colse the window or tab. Parameters:

Parameters:
The - name of the window or tab you want to close
Returns:
true if successfully close the page. (Catalog); otherwise, returns false.

waitForExepectedCondition

public void waitForExepectedCondition(org.openqa.selenium.support.ui.ExpectedCondition<java.lang.Boolean> booleanCondition,
                                      int timeOutInMilliseconds,
                                      java.lang.String message)
Convenience method for waiting for element to load and ignore the StaleElementReferenceException. NOTE: Models a condition that might reasonably be expected to eventually evaluate to something that is neither null nor false. Examples would include determining if a web page has loaded or that an element is visible. Parameters:

Parameters:
booleanCondition - -Models a condition that might reasonably be expected to eventually evaluate to something that is neither null nor false. Examples would include determining if a web page has loaded or that an element is visible. .
timeOutInMilliseconds - -The time of limit
message - -The tag information

getElement

public org.openqa.selenium.WebElement getElement(java.lang.String elementLocator)
Convenience method for getting getting WebElement object according to the locator type, by default, if no sign is indicated, cssSelector will be used. Otherwise, specified selector will be used.

WARNING: if a css locator is used within an area that is not located by css locator, parentLocator with css locator must be specified to make it works. Or, you may put "=" sign in front of it.

Parameters:
elementLocator - locator get from jsonMap
Returns:
WebElement Object.

getElements

public java.util.List<org.openqa.selenium.WebElement> getElements(java.lang.String elementLocator)
Convenience method for getting a list of WebElement objects according to the locator specified. by default, if no sign is indicated, cssSelector will be used. Otherwise, specified selector will be used.

WARNING: if a css locator is used within an area that is not located by css locator, parentLocator with css locator must be specified to make it works. Or, you may put "=" sign in front of it.

Parameters:
elementLocator -
Returns:
WebElement Object.

switchToPromptWindow

public void switchToPromptWindow(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> before,
                                 java.util.Set<java.lang.String> after)
Convenience method for switching to prompted window. NOTE: When we click on a link on the current page, it will open another new window or new sub tab , we need to swich to the new window or tab . Using the method need to combine with method of "getWindowHandles()" . Example: At first,you need to get before data by "getWindowHandles()" Second step ,Click on a link . Third ,Get all imformation for current windows by "getWindowHandles()" . Fourth ,Calls 'switchToPromptWindow' and switch to prompted window Parameters:

Parameters:
before - - before click on an element ,all infomation for current windows
after - - after click on an element ,all infomation for current windows

getWindowHandles

public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getWindowHandles()
Convenience method for getting all information of current windows. Parameters:

Returns:
all information of current windows

isElementNotEnabled

public boolean isElementNotEnabled(java.lang.String elementName)
Convenience method for waiting for element not enabled. NOTE:Is the element currently enabled or not? This will generally return true for everything but disabled input elements. Default time out is 120 seconds Parameter:

Parameters:
elementName - -the name of valid Selenium locator string in uiMap .

Parameters:
elementName - -the name of valid Selenium locator string in uiMap .
